messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns
messages.msgSnippet: ... Marty   mentioned that one last night.   Good one! One friend showed up after work without a costume, and Kirby s threat was anyone not in a costume had to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/30/05 12:08:05 PM, canderson51@... writes:


> There is a scene at a convent in Charlie's Angels (the second one, I
> think--"Full Throttle"), where the Angels are dressed as nuns meeting with a
> real nun.  You could be a "Cameron Diaz" nun! <g>  That's pretty recent and
> something most teens would find relevant.
>

Marty mentioned that one last night. Good one!

One friend showed up after work without a costume, and Kirby's threat was
anyone not in a costume had to strip and go as a porn star, so he said that to
Cathyn, who said "Okay, whoever wants to see the fat white guy naked, raise your
hand. Marty (as Dr. Strangelove) raised his gloved hand STRAIGHT UP in the
air and was beating it back down with the other hand, as though desperately
trying NOT to vote yes. Good use of character. <g>

Brett showed up late in a cow costume, Marty asked him if that single glove
he was wearing was Brett's, from Hallowe'en, they discussed it, decided not,
and then Brett very straight-facedly said to Marty "Your Michael Jackson costume
sucks."

We were wishing we'd had black fishnets and a little plaid blanket, so that
Marty could've broken into a little bit of Dr. Scott from Rocky Horror. Next
time, maybe, now that he's gathered all the costume bits.

The dark shades were a last minute find, $1.50, and they seem just
right--high and round and wire-rimmed and dark. Holly and I found them at Savers.

Marty as Dr. Strangelove is here:
http://journals.aol.com/sandradodd/KirbyParty/
third down



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns
messages.msgSnippet: There is a scene at a convent in Charlie s Angels (the second one, I think-- Full Throttle ), where the Angels are dressed as nuns meeting with a real nun.
messages.messageBody:
There is a scene at a convent in Charlie's Angels (the second one, I
think--"Full Throttle"), where the Angels are dressed as nuns meeting with a
real nun. You could be a "Cameron Diaz" nun! <g> That's pretty recent and
something most teens would find relevant.

Betsy S.

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns
messages.msgSnippet: Change of Habit ...an old Elvis movie with Mary Tyler Moore as one of the nuns. Return to Me ...not very old, small but funny movie we LOVE here with  David
messages.messageBody:
"Change of Habit"...an old Elvis movie with Mary Tyler Moore as one of the
nuns.

"Return to Me"...not very old, small but funny movie we LOVE here with David
Duchovny (sp) and Minnie Driver.

Nancy B.

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns
messages.messageBody:
<<<<I could say "The Singing Nun" and then sing, but that wasn't a movie,
just a
pop song. >>>>

Yes it was. Debbie Reynolds...

The Trouble With Angels (Rosalind Russell)
Where Angels Go Trouble Follows (Rosalind Russell)
The Nun's Story (Audrey Hepburn)
The Bells of Saint Mary's (Ingrid Bergman & Bing Crosby)
Lilies of the Field (Sydney Poitier - he wasn't a nun)
There's another one about French nun's trying to start a hospital in the New
England countryside and being opposed by the composer next door.
The Song of Bernadette

Try www.imdb.com and type in nuns in the plot keyword search.

Robyn L. Coburn

--

Birthday!) and he's

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns
messages.msgSnippet: Young as they are, SURELY  some holiday season they saw Bells of St. Mary s? Lots of nuns to choose from..be a different one to each questioner. ... From:
messages.messageBody:
Young as they are, SURELY some holiday season they saw Bells of St. Mary's?
Lots of nuns to choose from..be a different one to each questioner.





-----Original Message-----
From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
SandraDodd@...
Sent: Friday, July 29, 2005 10:12 AM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] movies with nuns



Kirby's birthday is today (so is Amy/arcarpenter's--Happy Birthday!) and
he's
having a costume party with "movie character" theme. I was going to be
Fiona from About a Boy, but decided to be a nun instead. I thought I'd
just
tell people who asked that I was the nun from that movie... you know, the
movie
with the nun, and then name a different movie every time. They should be

movies the teens might've seen, and my list so far is
Blues Brothers
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Dogma
The Sound of Music
Sister Act

I could say "The Singing Nun" and then sing, but that wasn't a movie, just a

pop song. None of them were born then anyway.

For things they won't recognize that have nuns, I thought of
Lilies of the Field
Two Mules for Sister Sara (fake nun, but still...)
Brother Sun, Sister Moon
El Cid

I'm guessing people here will have lots of ideas I'm just not getting at the

moment.

Sandra

not sure if she shows up in the movie version or not).

Moore

Some that maybe don't count:
Sister Wendy's Story of Painting (not really a movie)
Dead Man Walking (she doesn't wear a habit)
Vertigo (the nuns just walk by, as I recall)
